1.text: “Surely there is a mine for silver, and a place for gold which they refine.

2.text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and copper is smelted out of the ore.

3.text: Man sets an end to darkness, and searches out, to the furthest bound, the stones of obscurity and of thick darkness.

4.text: He breaks open a shaft away from where people live. They are forgotten by the foot. They hang far from men, they swing back and forth.

5.text: As for the earth, out of it comes bread; Underneath it is turned up as it were by fire.

6.text: Sapphires come from its rocks. It has dust of gold.

7.text: That path no bird of prey knows, neither has the falcon’s eye seen it.

8.text: The proud animals have not trodden it, nor has the fierce lion passed by there.

9.text: He puts forth his hand on the flinty rock, and he overturns the mountains by the roots.

10.text: He cuts out channels among the rocks. His eye sees every precious thing.

11.text: He binds the streams that they don’t trickle. The thing that is hidden he brings forth to light.

12.text: “But where shall wisdom be found? Where is the place of understanding?

13.text: Man doesn’t know its price; Neither is it found in the land of the living.

14.text: The deep says, ‘It isn’t in me.’ The sea says, ‘It isn’t with me.’

15.text: It can’t be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for its price.

16.text: It can’t be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

17.text: Gold and glass can’t equal it, neither shall it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.

18.text: No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal. Yes, the price of wisdom is above rubies.

19.text: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, Neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

20.text: Where then does wisdom come from? Where is the place of understanding?

21.text: Seeing it is hidden from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the birds of the sky.

22.text: Destruction and Death say, ‘We have heard a rumor of it with our ears.’

23.text: “God understands its way, and he knows its place.

24.text: For he looks to the ends of the earth, and sees under the whole sky.

25.text: He establishes the force of the wind. Yes, he measures out the waters by measure.

26.text: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder;

27.text: then he saw it, and declared it. He established it, yes, and searched it out.

28.text: To man he said, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom. To depart from evil is understanding.’”
